isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - CLEAN AND INSPECT - CLEAN

step1.para: Use a cleaning solvent to clean ground or polished parts or surfaces. Kerosene or diesel fuel oil can be used for this purpose. DO NOT USE GASOLINE.

warning.para: Be careful when using cleaning solvents. Follow the solvent manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent injury.

step1.para: Use a tool with a flat blade if required to remove gasket material from parts. Be careful not to damage the ground surfaces.

caution.para: DO NOT clean ground or polished parts in a hot solution tank, water, steam or alkaline solutions.

step1.para: Clean rough parts the same as cleaning ground and polished parts.
Rough parts can be cleaned in hot solution tanks with a weak alkaline solution.
Parts must remain in hot solution tanks until completely cleaned.

warning.para: Be careful when using hot solution tanks and alkaline solutions. Follow the alkaline manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent injury.

step1.para: Parts must be washed with water until the solution is removed.
A complete axle assembly can be steam cleaned on the outside to remove dirt.
Before the axle is steam cleaned, close or put a cover over all openings in the axle assembly. Examples of openings are breathers or vents in air chambers.

svcsubproc.title: Dry Parts That Have Been Cleaned

step1.para: Parts must be dried immediately after cleaning and washing.
Dry the parts using soft, clean, paper or cloth rags.
Except for bearings, parts can be dried with compressed air.

caution.para: Damage to bearings can be caused if dried by rotating with compressed air.

svcsubproc.title: Prevent Corrosion and Rust on Cleaned Parts

step1.para: Apply axle lubricant to cleaned and dried parts that are not damaged and are to be assembled.
To store parts, apply a special material that prevents corrosion and rust to all surfaces. Wrap them in a special paper that prevents corrosion and rust.
